hints.content:
To find the total number of hours that Jerry played with his friends, we need to add.

![](web+graphie://ka-perseus-graphie.s3.amazonaws.com/2f1bc9d228e0550ee3a8a3b83f17aacd5714c6cd)

$\maroonD{1\dfrac78} + \blueD{1\dfrac34} + \purpleD{\dfrac32} = \text{ hours spent playing}$

Our denominators need to be the same so we can add. 

What is the least common multiple for the denominators $\maroonD8$, $\blueD{4}$, and $\purpleD{2}$?

The least common multiple of $\maroonD8$, $\blueD{4}$, and $\purpleD{2}$ is $\greenD{8}$.

$\dfrac{\blueD{3}\times 2}{\blueD{4}\times 2} = \blueD{\dfrac{6}{8}}$

$\dfrac{\purpleD{3}\times 4}{\purpleD{2}\times 4} = \purpleD{\dfrac{12}{8}}$

Now we can add our fractions.

$\begin{align}
&\maroonD{1} &\maroonD{\dfrac7{8}}\\\\
&\blueD{1}&\blueD{\dfrac{6}{8}}\\
+&\purpleD{0}&\purpleD{\dfrac{12}{8}}\\
\hline{}\\
&&\greenD{\dfrac{25}{8}}\\
\end{align}$

Now we can add our whole numbers.

$\begin{align}
&\greenD3\\
&\maroonD{1} &\maroonD{\dfrac7{8}}\\\\
&\blueD{1}&\blueD{\dfrac{6}{8}}\\
+&\purpleD{0}&\purpleD{\dfrac{12}{8}}\\
\hline{}\\
&5&{\dfrac{1}{8}}\\
\end{align}$

Jerry played with his three friends for $\dfrac{41}{8}$ hours today.

This can also be written as $5\dfrac{1}{8}$ hours.

question.content:
Jerry played with $3$ friends today, all at different times.  He played with Tommy for $1\dfrac{7}{8}$ hours, then Nathan for $1\dfrac{3}{4}$ hours, then Chris for $\dfrac{3}{2}$ hours.

**How many hours did Jerry play with his $3$ friends today?**
